classes.cCustomNote: Choose one of the following: STAT217, or STAT218.
Choose one of the following: BIO161, or BOT121.
Choose one of the following: BIO162, or NR208.

One course from each of the following GE areas must be completed: A1, A2, A3, C1, C2, Lower-Division C Elective, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, E, F, and GE Elective. Upper-Division C should be taken only after Junior standing is reached (90 units). Refer to the online catalog for GE course selection, United States Cultural Pluralism (USCP), and Graduation Writing Requirement (GWR). The USCP requirement can be satisfied by some (but not all) courses within GE categories: C1, Upper-Division C, D1, D2, Upper-Division D, or E.

Students can attempt to fulfill the requirement after 90 earned units; students should complete the requirement before senior year. Any GWR course or GWR exam can go here. Refer to the current catalog for prerequisites.
Choose one of the following: BRAE348, or ENVE324.

Any Approved Elective course can go here. Select from the following: BRAE340, BRAE345, BRAE532; ERSC303, ERSC323, ERSC442, ERSC443; GEOL241; NR260, NR315, NR339, NR400, NR413, NR418, NR422, NR474; NR/BIO/SS 421; NR/CRP 408; PHYS107; SS431, SS440; STAT313.

See course catalog for options. If a course is taken to meet a major requirement, it cannot be double-counted as an approved elective for the concentration. Consultation with an advisor is recommended prior to selecting approved electives; bear in mind your selections may impact pursuit of post-baccalaureate studies and/or goals.
